course_title: Topics in Italian Culture: The Case of Japan and Italy
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 9 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
ITAL 276  Business Communication in the Globalized World: the Case of Japan and Italy
Crosslisted with JPN 285
Profs. Muratore/Mizzotta (Mon-Wed. 1-2:15pm in person)
Content:  This course will prioritize the acquisition of business-related vocabulary, an understanding of best practices for business communication and etiquette, as well as the development of collaborative and communication skills. This course consists of classroom lectures in English (whole class), language-based sessions (Italian group and Japanese group will meet separately), and a community-engaged learning module.   Prerequisites: ITAL 201 / JPN 202.
course_description: Topics to be announced each semester. Course content will vary, including topics of literature, history, culture, art history, political thought, business, current trends, and more. May be repeated for credit when syllabus changes.
